评论详情: Great fit

The first size 10R was a bit tight for me, but I kept them for durability,  sleek fit. I'm 5'-8, 150 lbs. I sent for a 12L after that. The 12 fits great, although too long. Still great, of course, they're Dickies.
Too tight in hips and thighs !

评论概述: Runs small for people with a figure or who workout
评论详情: I’m typically a size 4 or 6 in other brands. I bought these in a 6 and couldn’t even get them over my thighs.  I’m very muscular at 135 lbs. and exchanged for an 8 so we will see how those go. There is zero stretch.

These pants faded really bad after the first wash. The fading is so bad they look like I’ve had them for 10 years and just refuse to throw them out. Oh and the wrinkles are horrible as well. When you iron them it makes the fading look even worse. The only thing I like about these pants is they’re comfortable.
Nice fit

The pants are ok, but I was sent the wrong size. I ordered a size 2 and received a size 4. I wanted to wear these in 2 days. Now I have to go through the whole return experience. I'm very very disappointed. Sigh.

评论概述: Quality Material, but not built for Curvy Bodies
评论详情: I am 5’8 and roughly 162. I have more of an hour glass figure and struggle finding pants. I bought a set of 10s and 12s as I typically wear a 10. I actually like the fit of the 12s best for a more relaxed fit minus the HUGE gap. I typically struggle with length of pants and think the Regulars are just fine unless you plan on wearing something with a heel. Debating having the back taken in on them. Pictures included of both sizes but forgot to take pics of the length difference.

评论概述: Nice pants but…I’m not sure I would recommend them
评论详情: So, I purchased 4 pair of these pants for my girls for school. They sent me 3 of the wrong pair of pants. I received 3 bootcut/flair and 1 straight. Now, I have to send them back and I’m afraid to repurchase them because I might get the wrong pair again. It’s weird that for them to all be the same size 16 that 1 daughter can only fit 1 pair(the straight which she doesn’t like. She likes the bootcut but can’t even button them up) and my other daughter hates the bootcut( which fit perfectly and the straight is way to big which she loves the straight)🤦🏾‍♀️ this is very annoying.

The quality of the fabric used is great; very thick and will hold up well for the kiddos. I normally wear a size 14 and these didn't even come close to fitting; may need to go up one size maybe two depending on how tight you want to wear them. Not a fan overall.
They were very baggy for me and I had to hem them.  I thought that I had the measurements correct, but I was wrong.
Absolutely love these pants! I recently needed some new works pants and came across these. They are so comfortable.
Fit great, but one of the bottom hems on one of the legs was completely unraveled

I’m obsessed with these pants. They are so comfortable and also very versatile — easy to wear as an everyday item or to work. My only wish is that they were high waisted instead of mid-rise. Also, they run a bit small, so I would size up.

评论概述: Sizes aren't even close to normal
评论详情: I'm a size 18. Depending on the brand, time of the month, etc., size 18 clothes may be a bit tight or a bit loose. Sometimes I find that due to the cut of a pair of pants, I may prefer 18 long instead of the standard 18. But end of the day I am a size 18. The 18L pants I ordered are not a size 18. They're more like a size 8. Based on my build I would understand if a new pair of pants from a brand I'm not familiar with, say... wouldn't zip up, or felt too tight in the thighs, or something like that. But these pants got stuck AROUND MY KNEES. It's ironic that the wastband says something about being made for women. These things were maybe made for an adolescent branchless tree. Worst pants ever.

I needed a new pair of work pants for an industrial setting. These fit fantastic and are very durable but they also wrinkle! Even after ironing them they still look like I just rolled out of bed in them.
Everything is good except the sewing, I've had to get them repaired twice now at the waistline due to faulty sewing. The waistline and legs came completely apart and I've only worn them twice
This is so wonderful, and it fits comfortably too!!

I bought these pants for work and they’re comfortable. However, the waist is the same size width as the butt. The pants constantly fall down because they’re too big for my waist to hold up while they fit my legs fine.

when I tried on they were a perfect fit. after a first wash the shrunk in length and in waist. I would say buy bigger than you wear. Fabric is soft and does stretch a bit during wear.

I ordered 2 sizes,  a size 2 and 16. My size 16 didn't have a tag and looked like they have been worn before.  The size 16 was wrinkly and no tags. They are expensive pants to have been given what looks like used pants.

... do these pants fit perfectly. I am 5'4" so I ordered the short version. They were perfect before washing and then shrunk so much in length that when I am sitting the leg comes up half of my calf. They fit very well other than the length. The black is also fading pretty quickly.

Everything else is satisfactory other than being a bit long. I don't order petite because they would be too short. That's not on Dickies.  It's on my genes lol.

These pants were good quality but honestly just felt like I was wearing smaller mens pants with how they fit. The “straight leg” was more like boot cut, they were so long that I was stepping on the pants even with shoes, and because they fit like boot cut it looked absolutely ridiculous rolling them up. They are also somehow BIGGER than some size 12 pants I have… yet these are a size 10?? How is a 10 larger than a 12??? I’m so tired of womens clothing being inconsistent. I literally have no clue what size pants I even wear because they all fit differently :(( why can manufacturers do it for men’s clothing but women’s clothing is impossible? So frustrating. I’m ~5’7, 150lbs

Within the last 6 months I’ve bought 5 pair. The original 3 I bought already have rips in the knees so I had to replace them (last pair ripped today). I do a lot of kneeling down at work but that shouldn’t cause a pair of pants designed for work to rip. Not what I have come the expect from the Dickies brand. I’m very disappointed. Since I was young, whenever I needed work pants, I always immediately got Dickies. I’ve never had a problem with them. They were more expensive but always lasted and looked great. Purchased patches to repair the ripped ones but I’m afraid from now on I’m going to have purchase another type. I can’t afford to keep replacing them. Otherwise the pants fit nice and loose, always wrinkle free, and still look like new, they just have rips in the knee.
